input.content:
# GitHub Issue Assignment Analysis

## Recent 25 Issues (May 25-30, 2025)

### @AgentEnder - Nx Core, Devkit, Configuration & Plugins
- **#31394** - Watch-deps fails when using yarn (Priority: Medium)
  - Core functionality issue with yarn package manager
- **#31392** - [Daemon] Possible memory leak (Priority: High)
  - Critical daemon performance issue
- **#31387** - create-nx-workspace ignores --linter option (Priority: Medium)
  - Core workspace creation functionality
- **#31381** - Nx does not find projects in TypeScript Monorepo Tutorial (Priority: High)
  - Core project detection issue affecting tutorials
- **#31349** - fix NX Failed to create workspace (Priority: High)
  - Critical workspace creation failure

### @leosvelperez - TypeScript & Testing Tools
- **#31401** - In @nx/eslint, --fix should respect --quiet (Priority: Medium)
  - ESLint tool configuration issue
- **#31382** - NX 21.1.2 Playwright, windows. Error: Unable to kill process (Priority: High)
  - Critical Playwright testing issue on Windows
- **#31371** - ESLint plugin import module error (Priority: Medium)
  - ESLint configuration and dependency issue
- **#31358** - VS Code official jest extension gets TS5110 module error (Priority: Medium)
  - TypeScript configuration issue with Jest
- **#31353** - @nx/jest cannot include test files (Priority: Medium)
  - Jest configuration and file inclusion issue
- **#31351** - @nx/jest resolves ts paths wrong (Priority: Medium)

{"body":"### Current Behavior

When using `eslint` directly, `eslint --fix --quiet` will only fix issues that aren't silenced by `--quiet`. However `nx run lint --quiet --fix` has the opposite behavior - it will attempt to autofix all lint issues, even ones that would normally be ignored by `--quiet`.

In other words, `nx run lint --quiet --fix` behaves the same as `nx run lint --fix`.

I think it's an easy fix - pull request incoming...

### Expected Behavior

`nx run lint --quiet --fix` should only fix issues that aren't silenced by `--quiet`

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Write some code that produces fixable lint warnings (not errors)
2. Verify that those warnings are silenced by `--quiet` and appear without `--quiet`
3. Run `nx run lint --quiet --fix` and observe that the warnings are fixed

{"body":"### Current Behavior


Following this article https://nx.dev/blog/new-nx-experience-for-typescript-monorepos  results in an error when executing `watch-deps` when using `yarn v1.22.22`.

```bash
 *  Executing task: yarn nx run MyViteApp:watch-deps 

yarn run v1.22.22
$ /Users/**/Projects/nx-workspaces/tsmono/node_modules/.bin/nx run MyViteApp:watch-deps

> nx run @tsmono/buildablelib:build  [existing outputs match the cache, left as is]


> nx run MyViteApp:build-deps


> nx run MyViteApp:watch-deps

> yarn nx watch --projects MyViteApp --includeDependentProjects -- yarn nx build-deps MyViteApp

warning From Yarn 1.0 onwards, scripts don\'t require "--" for options to be forwarded. In a future version, any explicit "--" will be forwarded as-is to the scripts.
$ /Users/**/Projects/nx-workspaces/tsmono/node_modules/.bin/nx watch yarn nx build-deps MyViteApp
No command specified for watch mode.
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

Upon investigation it appears that yarn is stripping the `--` from the arguments passed to https://github.com/nrwl/nx/blob/master/packages/nx/src/command-line/watch/command-object.ts#L61 resulting in the function parameter `args` not continuing a property `--`.

```typescript
// console.log(args)
{ 
    _: [ 'watch', 'yarn', 'nx', 'build-deps', 'MyViteApp' ],
    '$0': 'nx' 
}
```

This warning provided in the terminal output does outline the issue.

```
warning From Yarn 1.0 onwards, scripts don\'t require "--" for options to be forwarded. In a future version, any explicit "--" will be forwarded as-is to the scripts.
```

### Expected Behavior

It should execute the `watch-deps` target without failing.

### GitHub Repo

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Follow the steps outlined in the Blog article from NX team at https://nx.dev/blog/new-nx-experience-for-typescript-monorepos#key-highlight-performance

## Assignment Review Summary

2. **#31381** moved from @AgentEnder → @leosvelperez (TypeScript monorepo issue)
3. **#31349** moved from @AgentEnder → @ndcunningham

## Scope Tag Assignments

### @AgentEnder Issues
- **#31394** - Watch-deps fails when using yarn
  - **Scope**: `scope: core` (watch functionality is core Nx)
- **#31392** - [Daemon] Possible memory leak  
  - **Scope**: `scope: core` (daemon is core infrastructure)
- **#31387** - create-nx-workspace ignores --linter option
  - **Scope**: `scope: core` (workspace creation is core)

### @leosvelperez Issues  
- **#31401** - In @nx/eslint, --fix should respect --quiet
  - **Scope**: `scope: linting` (ESLint functionality)
- **#31382** - NX 21.1.2 Playwright, windows. Error: Unable to kill process
  - **Scope**: `scope: testing tools` (already has this label)
- **#31381** - Nx does not find projects in TypeScript Monorepo Tutorial
  - **Scope**: `scope: core` (project detection is core, but TS-related)
- **#31371** - ESLint plugin import module error
  - **Scope**: `scope: linting` (ESLint configuration)
- **#31358** - VS Code official jest extension gets TS5110 module error
  - **Scope**: `scope: testing tools` (Jest/TypeScript integration)
- **#31353** - @nx/jest cannot include test files
  - **Scope**: `scope: testing tools` (Jest configuration)
- **#31351** - @nx/jest resolves ts paths wrong
  - **Scope**: `scope: testing tools` (Jest/TypeScript path resolution)

### @Coly010 Issues
- **#31397** - module-federation requiredVersion/strictVersion has no affect
  - **Scope**: `scope: module federation` (already has this label)
- **#31384** - Cant add nest application on angular 20 workspace
  - **Scope**: `scope: node` (NestJS is Node.js framework)
- **#31383** - nest application marks buildable js lib as external
  - **Scope**: `scope: node` (NestJS library dependencies)
- **#31366** - svg import error in react library
